card.text: Constructed with only handful of men with a few mules for transportation due to WWI.
The Chapel was dedicated on 16 October 1926 to the memory of the Rev. Samuel Valentine Cole, Trustee from 1893 to 1925, and College President from 1897 until his death in 1925.
The seating capacity of the main floor and the galleries is about nine hundred.
The spire rises to the height of one hundred and forty-seven feet from the ground.
The Chapel was once used for required morning chapel and Sunday services.
It continues to be used for formal lectures, concerts, Convocations, and the Candlelight Ceremony.
